job.title: Data Scientist
job.description:
As an enthusiastic and curious data professional, you’ll have the opportunity to apply your statistics and technical skills to help Garmin Product Support provide superior customer support, and aid in our attempt to eliminate customer disruptions entirely!  You’ll regularly teach leaders about how data might be better leveraged as well as advise decision makers on strategically important issues.  All the while, you’ll be able to work with a talented, driven and close-knit team based in our Support Center in Olathe, KS—come join the fun!

Research and Technical Expertise
  • Translate business problems and questions into appropriate research questions, data gathering and statistical analysis methods
  • Provide actionable steps to be taken based off of data analysis
  • Articulate the caveats and weaknesses of a given dataset
  • Use quantitative skills to answer questions directly posed by business, and proactively seek out questions whose answers would benefit the business
  • Transform formulated problems into implementation plans for experiments by applying (and creating when necessary) the appropriate methods, algorithms, and tools, and statistically validating the results against biases and errors to communicate most effectively


Strives to Make Things Better
  • Constantly identify and present opportunities to leverage new or existing data towards monitoring and reducing customer product disruptions, and providing superior customer support
  • Is intellectually curious and constantly digging into data to gain a better understanding
  • Yearns to continually learn new tools, skills and concepts


Superior Communication Skills
  • Conveys complex technical and statistical concepts in an easy-to-understand way
  • Adept at evaluating business questions and differentiating between what is interesting versus valuable
  • Adept at condensing large-scale analysis efforts into succinct, easy-to-understand visualizations that are actionable
  • Excels at collaborating with a team of researchers
  • Able to conduct peer reviews in an open, honest and respectful manner
  • Provides technical direction, mentoring, training and guidance to other individual contributors in the group
  • Professionally approaches situations in which conflict is present


Values
  • Demonstrates a thorough knowledge of Garmin’s processes and procedures as they are implemented throughout the company
  • Exemplifies Garmin’s Mission Statement, Vision, Values and Quality Policy and proactively works to improve Garmin’s image and culture 
  • Participate in project definition activities including feature analysis and system tradeoffs
  • Perform other duties as necessary
